questions.question: Inter-Process Communication (IPC) is a technique that allows processes to communicate within the operating system.
The Shared Memory IPC model is slower than the Message Passing IPC model.
In the Shared Memory IPC model, kernel intervention is required for every memory access.
Which of the following is NOT a model of Inter-Process Communication?
What is a major challenge in the Shared Memory IPC model?
choices: Requiring kernel intervention for each access

questions.question: In the Message Passing IPC model, which of the following operations are required?
Direct Communication in Message Passing IPC requires processes to explicitly name each other.
In Indirect Communication, messages are directed through unique identifiers known as mailboxes.
Which of the following is a property of Direct Communication in Message Passing IPC?
choices: Link is associated with many processes
Each pair of processes may have several links

questions.question: In the context of Message Passing IPC, what does a zero capacity buffer imply?
choices: The sender must wait for the receiver
The buffer can hold an infinite number of messages
The buffer can hold a finite number of messages
